abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is
            satisfactory, sustainability likely, and the institutional
            development impact substantial. Lessons address: 1) the
            quality, and relevance of education, and underlines the need
            to build local capacity for publishing pedagogic, and
            reading materials, to link all aspects of curriculum design,
            and textbook production, including the establishment of a
            publishing industry able to handle the emerging needs for
            Lao language materials. Pedagogic inputs were enhanced by
            the efficacy of Pedagogic Advisors as better trained
            teachers, able to improve education in the classroom, but
            spells out the need to support a variety of organizational
            options for primary school, encompassing both the grass root
            realities, and stakeholders involvement; 2) access to, and
            equity in education, highlighting the importance to approach
            implementation needs based on an understanding accepted by
            all stakeholders, prior to project implementation, and the
            efficacy of decentralized facilities programs, when
            attention is paid ex ante to building procurement, and
            construction management capacity. In addition, it emphasizes
            the usefulness of a construction management information
            system to implement civil works, provided attention is given
            to the design of a database structure; 3) management, and
            institution building, specifying the need to include
            institutional capacity analysis during preparation; and, 4)
            the need for close collaboration between the Bank, and
            donors to ensure continued interface during implementation,
            and assure sustainability through adequate budget allocation.

TF020250-FRENCH CONSULTANTS TRUST FUND,TF020600-FINNISH GENERAL CONSULTANT
            TRUST FUND,TF036527-LAO PEOPLE'S DEMOCRATIC -
            GENDER DIMENSIONS OF EDUCATION,TF032132-LAOS - HUMAN RESOURCES,TF039282-LAO PDR - EDUCATION DEVELOPMENT
            PROJECT (II),TF024365-EDUCATION DEVELOPMENT PROJECT,TF028100-CANADIAN CONSULTANT TRUST FUND (AR),TF020760-AUSTRALIAN CONSULTANTS TRUST
            FUND - 0,TF025920-EDUCATION REFORM PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The project aims to address immediate
            needs for quality improvement in basic education, and to
            establish the policy and institutional frameworks for
            longer-term sector development.  Specifically, the project
            will:  (a) develop and implement new curricula,
            instructional materials and pedagogical support systems in
            primary and lower secondary education; (b) lay the
            foundation for a sustainable construction program for
            primary and lower secondary schools; (c) establish systems
            of data collection and analysis to support sector management
            and strategic planning; and (d) strengthen institutional
            capacities in educational administrative and management at
            the central and local levels.  To carry out these
            activities, the project will finance civil works, furniture,
            equipment, instructional materials, training, technical
            assistance, and project management and operations.
